tit.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 藤原 成頼（ふじわら の なりより、保延2年(1136年) - 建仁2年(1202年)）は平安時代末期から鎌倉時代初期にかけての公卿。
sen.e: Born in 1136 and gone in 1202, "FUJIWARA no Nariyori" was a "kugyo" (top court official) living from the late Heian period to the early Kamakura period.
Born in 1136, diedin 1202, "FUJIWARA no Nariyori" was a "kugyo" (top court official) living from the late Heian period to the early Kamakura period.
FUJIWARA no Nariyori (1136 - 1202) was a kugyo (top court official) living from the late Heian period to the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞき補足しました。

sen.j: 藤原北家勧修寺流、権中納言藤原顕頼の三男（四男とも）。
sen.e: He belonged to the Kaju-ji line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and he was the third son (some say the fourth son) of "FUJIWARA no Akiyori" who rose to the title of "Gon no chunagon" (Deputy Middle Councilor).

He belonged to the Kaju-ji line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and he was the third son (some say the fourth son) of "FUJIWARA no Akiyori" who rose to the title of "Gon no chunagon" (Deputy Middle Councilor).

He belonged to the Kanjuji line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and he was the third son (some say the fourth son) of FUJIWARA no Akiyori of Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞき補足しました。

sen.j: 母は権中納言藤原俊忠の娘で、藤原光頼、藤原惟方の同母弟に当たる。
sen.e: Nariyori's mother was the daughter of "FUJIWARA no Toshitada" who also rose to Gon no chunagon, and Nariyori was the younger real brother of "FUJIWARA no Mitsuyori" and of "FUJIWARA no Korekata."
sen.cmt: ※成頼は後に兄・光頼の養子になりますが、光頼の実の弟でもある（「同母弟」という言い回しの意味もそこにある、と考えます）ので、左でも「実の」と補っています。
sen.e: Nariyori's mother was the daughter of "FUJIWARA no Toshitada" who also rose to Gon no chunagon, and Nariyori was the younger real brother of "FUJIWARA no Mitsuyori" and of "FUJIWARA no Korekata."
Nariyori's mother was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Toshitada of Gon Chunagon, and Nariyori was the younger half brother of FUJIWARA no Mitsuyori and of FUJIWARA no Korekata.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞき補足しました。

sen.e: Nariyori rose to the rank of "Shosanmi" (Senior Third Rank), and to the title of "Sangi" (Royal Adviser) & "Shuri no daibu" (Master of the Office of Palace Repairs).
Nariyori rose to the rank of "Shosanmi" (Senior Third Rank), and to the title of "Sangi" (Royal Adviser) and "Shuri no daibu" (Master of the Office of Palace Repairs).
Nariyori rose to the rank of Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), and to the title of Sangi (councilor) and Shuri no daibu (Master of the Office of Palace Repairs).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞき補足しました。

sen.e: Nariyori became an adoptee of his real elder brother Mitsuyori.
sen.cmt: ※「猶子」は「兄弟の子を自分の子とすること」ですが、ここにはうまく当てはまりませんので、恐らくは「養子」の誤りと解されます。（kotobank.jp 「藤原成頼」の解説にも、「成頼は兄光頼の養子になった」との記述が見られます。）それゆえ、そのように訂正してあります。
sen.e: Nariyori became an adoptee of his real elder brother Mitsuyori.
He became an adoptee of his elder brother Mitsuyori.
In 1158, Nariyori was conferred a peerage of "Kurodo" (the Palace Officer).

In 1158, Nariyori was conferred the peerage of Kurodo (Chamberlain).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞき補足しました。

sen.j: 平治元年(1159年)の平治の乱に際しては、兄の惟方が藤原信頼の叛乱軍に一旦加担しながら寝返るという動きを見せる中、成頼は終始冷静に行動し、後白河上皇を内裏から無事に脱出させる。
sen.e: When "Heiji no ran" (the Heiji War) broke out in 1159, Nariyori's brother Korekata once took part in the rebel army of "FUJIWARA no Nobuyori" and then swithed sides, but Nariyori's action was coolheaded from start to finish, so he enabled the Retired Emperor Goshirakawa to escape from "Dairi" (the Inner Palace).

When the Heiji War broke out in 1159, his brother Korekata once took part in the rebel army of FUJIWARA no Nobuyori and then switched sides, but Nariyori's action was coolheaded from start to finish, so he enabled the Retired Emperor Goshirakawa to escape from Dairi (the Inner Palace).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞき補足しました。

sen.j: 上皇、及びこれに先立って脱出していた二条天皇がともに平清盛の六波羅邸に入ると、成頼はこのことを公卿・諸大夫の間に触れて回り、戦局を一気に清盛の側に有利なものとすることに貢献した。
sen.e: When Emperor Nijo who already escaped from Dairi & the retired emperor both entered the Rokuhara house of "TAIRA no Kiyomori," Nariyori heralded it as a sign of Kiyomori's legitimacy to kugyo & "shodaibu" (courtiers), so Nariyori contributed to a drastic shift in the tide of the war in Kiyomori's favor.

When Emperor Nijo who already escaped from Dairi and the retired emperor both entered the Rokuhara residence of TAIRA no Kiyomori, Nariyori heralded it as a sign of Kiyomori's legitimacy to kugyo and Shodaibu (aristocracy lower than Kugyo), so Nariyori contributed to a drastic shift in the tide of the war in Kiyomori's favor.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞき補足しました。

sen.j: こうしたことからその後も平氏政権とも関係は良好であり、清盛の盟友の藤原邦綱の娘を妻とし、高倉天皇の乳母人となっている。
sen.e: Thereafter Nariyori's relationship with Taira regime was so good that he got married to a daughter of "FUJIWARA no Kunitsuna" who was the sworn friend of Kiyomori, and she became the nursing mother of Emperor Takakura afterward.

Thereafter his relationship with Taira clan government was so good that he got married to a daughter of FUJIWARA no Kunitsuna who was the sworn friend of Kiyomori, and she became the wet nurse of Emperor Takakura afterward.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞき補足しました。

sen.j: また仁安 (日本)元年(1166年)には邦綱の譲りを受けて参議に任ぜられている。
sen.e: And in 1166, Kunitsuna tranferred his title of "Sangi" to Nariyori.

sen.j: しかし、承安 (日本)4年(1174年)に兄光頼の一周忌を受けて出家。
sen.e: But in 1174, on the first anniversary of his brother Mitsuyori's death, Nariyori became a priest.
But in 1174, on the first anniversary of his brother Mitsuyori's death, Nariyori became a priest.
But in 1174, on the first anniversary of his brother Mitsuyori's death, he became a priest.

sen.j: 以降は高野山に上って隠棲し、高野宰相入道と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Thereafter Nariyori lived a secluded life in Koya-san Mountain, so he was called "Koya no saisho Nyudo" (Ex Royal Adviser & Priest at Koya-san Mountain)
sen.cmt: ※「宰相」は「太政官における参議の別称」であり（Wiki 「宰相」）、「入道」は「仏門に入った人物」（kotobank.jp 「入道」参照）なので、「高野宰相入道」の解説部分もそれを反映して「高野山の元参議・僧侶」としました。
sen.e: Thereafter Nariyori lived a secluded life on Koya-san Mountain, so he was called "Koya no saisho Nyudo" (Ex Royal Adviser & Priest at Koya-san Mountain)
Thereafter Nariyori lived a secluded life on Mt. Koya, so he was called Koya no saisho Nyudo (a priest monk councilor of Mt. Koya).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞき補足しました。

sen.j: 『平治物語』、『平家物語』を通じて賢人として描かれる人物であるが、『愚管抄』のようにその出家は無益であったと評する文書もある。
sen.e: In "Heiji Monogatari" (The tale of the Heiji War) & "Heike Monogatari" (The tale of the Taira Family), Nariyori was described as a wise man, but some writings like "Gukansho" said his becoming a priest was not good.
